title: Tabernacle Construction
shortSummary: Exodus 36 details the skilled craftsmanship and abundant offerings used in building the Tabernacle, emphasizing the wisdom God granted to Bezaleel, Aholiab, and the artisans. The chapter highlights the obedience and generosity of the Israelites in contributing materials and the careful, detailed work to fulfill God's commands for the sanctuary.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - The Exodus, during the wilderness journey after leaving Egypt

keyCharacters.name: Bezaleel
keyCharacters.description: The chief craftsman endowed by God with wisdom and skill to lead the construction of the Tabernacle.

keyCharacters.name: Aholiab
keyCharacters.description: An assistant to Bezaleel, also gifted with skill and wisdom for the artistic work of the sanctuary.

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The leader of Israel who oversees the work and commands the people regarding the offerings.

definitions.definition: Heavenly beings depicted as winged creatures, symbolizing God's presence and protection, embroidered on the Tabernacle curtains.
Clasp-like fasteners, often made of metal, used to join the curtains of the Tabernacle together.
A durable, fragrant wood from the acacia tree, used extensively in the construction of the Tabernacle's framework.
The finished edge of a piece of fabric that prevents it from unraveling, important in the making of the curtains.

outline.heading: The Skilled Workers Begin the Work
outline.description: Bezaleel, Aholiab, and other gifted craftsmen begin working on the Tabernacle, empowered by God’s wisdom. The people bring abundant offerings, exceeding what is needed for the sanctuary.

outline.heading: Moses Stops the Offerings
outline.description: Moses commands the people to stop bringing offerings because there is more than enough material to complete the work, demonstrating God’s provision and the people’s generosity.

outline.heading: Making the Linen Curtains
outline.description: The artisans craft ten curtains of fine linen with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, embroidered with cherubims, and join them with gold clasps to form one unified Tabernacle covering.

outline.heading: Goats' Hair Curtains and Outer Coverings
outline.description: Eleven goats' hair curtains are made and joined together with brass clasps, then covered with ram skins dyed red and badgers' skins, providing protection and durability.

outline.heading: Construction of the Tabernacle Boards and Bars
outline.description: The framework of the Tabernacle is constructed from shittim wood boards overlaid with gold, joined with silver sockets and gold rings, and reinforced with gold-covered bars.

outline.heading: The Veil and Entrance Hangings
outline.description: The veil separating the Holy Place from the Most Holy Place and the entrance hangings are made with fine linen and embroidered cherubims, supported by gold-covered pillars and sockets.

application: Seek God’s wisdom and skill in your work, trusting that He equips those He calls for His purposes.
Be generous in giving to God’s work, but also be obedient to His timing and instructions regarding resources.
Value careful, diligent craftsmanship as an act of worship and obedience to God’s commands.
Recognize that every believer has a role and gifting to contribute to the building up of God’s spiritual sanctuary, the church.

keyVerses.text: Then wrought Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whom the LORD put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all manner of work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that the LORD had commanded.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God’s direct empowerment of His chosen craftsmen to accomplish His holy work.

keyVerses.text: And they spake unto Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work, which the LORD commanded to make.
keyVerses.significance: It shows the generosity of the people and God’s abundant provision for His work.

keyVerses.text: And Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing.
keyVerses.significance: This verse teaches obedience to God’s timing and instructions, even in acts of worship and giving.

keyVerses.text: And every wise hearted man among them that wrought the work of the tabernacle made ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: with cherubims of cunning work made he them.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes the beauty and sacredness of the Tabernacle, crafted with skill and reverence.
